_header: And a woman of haunting mood
Note: Cf. 2451 which some say is the beginning of this work.
_description: ‘Disputacio inter Clericum et Philomenam’ — 85 lines in 20 quatrains plus two remnants

BodRawPoe34.First Lines:
And a woman off hauntyng moodeblythly sche wyll be
                    swyuyd…
BodRawPoe34.Last Lines:
…now wyl I fare in my wayI rede þou to my wordys tak
                    hede
BodRawPoe34.Attributed Title:
Explicit disputacio inter Clericum et philomenam et cetera (f.
                        5v)
BodRawPoe34.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 176-9.
Conlee,  John W.,
                        ed.  
             Middle English Debate Poetry: A Critical Anthology.
         East Lansing, MI: Colleagues Press, 1991: 272-7.
